subject: Sleep
title: The Spanish Siesta
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Spanish Siesta.

hook.text: Spain shuts down for two hours in the afternoon. Shops close, streets empty, and the nation sleeps. Or it used to.

buildup.text: The siesta evolved in hot climates where working through the afternoon heat was dangerous and unproductive.

discovery.text: A post-lunch dip in alertness occurs in all humans regardless of culture, aligned with a circadian trough.

twist.text: Modern Spain is abandoning the siesta. EU work schedules and long commutes make a midday nap impractical.

climax.text: Only about 18 percent of Spaniards still nap regularly, down from a majority just decades ago.

punchline.text: The siesta is dying just as science proves it was a great idea.

quiz.question: Why is the siesta declining in modern Spain?
options: EU work schedules and long commutes make midday naps impractical
